Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a light-brown pottery wine-jar, interior slightly grooved and exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip, with remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text on the exterior, worn in places, specifying the contents as year 12 western river wine of the Aten domain.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (389876) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/389876)
